Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before); MIDDLE KINGDOM; 12TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Head of a queen
Description: This limestone fragment probably comes from a statuette representing a queen as a sphinx. Dressed in a Hathoric wig, the head is characterised by the large eyes and cauliflower ears. The pieces dates from the Middle Kingdom, more specifically from the second half of the 12th Dynasty.
